SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange sought clarification from Apollo Hospitals Enterprise Limited with respect to a news item captioned "Apollo Hospitals ties up with US firm for mobile ECG devices". The Company has clarified that "Apollo Hospitals Enterprise Limited has signed a MOU with AliveCor (a US based Company) to tackle the growing problem of heart arrhythmia by empowering patients to check their heart health anywhere, anytime whereby AliveCor will provide their innovative mobile ECG devices as part of an Apollo branded arrhythmia screening and stroke prevention program. The device, developed and patented by AliveCor, is attached to mobile devices working on iOS and Android platforms. It helps individuals screen the incidence of heart arrhythmias (HA), associated with irregular heartbeat. It weighs ~ 40-50 g, captures the heartbeat of patients through finger impression and wirelessly records, displays, stores and transfers the heart rate and single channel electrocardiogram (ECG). The captured data, after passing through select algorithms, is interpreted by back-end healthcare teams analysing the ECG continuously and transmitting them to patients 24 hours a day. This in a way helps patients detected with HA and also others at risk to monitor the sudden changes in heartbeat and thereby leading to early diagnosis and better disease management. Cleared by the USFDA, AliveCor Heart Monitor is being marketed online for $200 in India. Apollo Through a group entity HealthNet Global, Apollo Hospitals plans to deliver the interpretative services to its patients. The service would be initially priced at Rs 1,000 a month. We do not expect any material impact to the Company , due to this development. There are no other relevant disclosures to be made".
